alternateName: A 2025 Deep Dive into Spotify’s Music Metadata

distribution.name: archive.zip
distribution.description: Archive containing all the contents of the Spotify Songs for ML & Analysis (8700+ tracks) dataset

distribution.name: spotify_data clean.csv
distribution.description:
This is the cleaned  version of the dataset  that contains detailed metadata for over 8,500 Spotify tracks, curated for analysis and machine learning applications. It includes normalized genre strings, standardized release dates, and filled missing values to ensure consistency and usability.

Key columns include track popularity, explicit content flags, artist and track names, and track numbers. All values have been cleaned to remove formatting inconsistencies, special characters, and null entries.

Ideal for exploratory data analysis, trend modeling, and music industry insights in 2025.

distribution.name: track_data_final.csv
distribution.description:
### Raw data without any changes just as we pulled it from Spotify API 



This file contains detailed metadata for over **8,700 Spotify tracks**, collected using the Spotify Web API. Each row represents a unique track and includes attributes related to the **track**, **artist**, and **album**.

## 🔍 Key Features:
- Track-level data including popularity, duration, and explicit content
- Artist-level data including popularity, follower count, and genres
- Album-level data including release date, total tracks, and album type

## 📊 Use Cases:
- Analyze how artist popularity influences track success
- Explore genre trends across different album types and release years
- Build machine learning models to predict song popularity
- Visualize music trends using Power BI, Python, or R

This file is ideal for music analysts, data scientists, and anyone curious about the patterns behind Spotify’s most streamed content.

field.name: track_id
field.description: Unique identifier for each track on Spotify. Used to reference and retrieve track-specific metadata via the Spotify API.

field.name: track_name
field.description: Title of the track as listed on Spotify. May include featured artists or remix labels.

field.name: track_number
field.description: Position of the track within its album or release. Useful for sequencing and album structure analysis.

field.name: track_popularity
field.description: Popularity score assigned by Spotify (0–100), based on recent streaming activity. A score of 0 may indicate missing or inactive tracks.

field.name: explicit
field.description: Boolean flag indicating whether the track contains explicit content (TRUE or FALSE).

field.name: artist_name
field.description: Name of the primary artist associated with the track. May include solo artists, bands, or collaborative acts.

field.name: artist_popularity
field.description: Popularity score of the artist (0–100).

field.name: artist_followers
field.description: Number of followers the artist has on Spotify.

field.name: artist_genres
field.description: List of genres associated with the artist.

field.name: album_id
field.description: Unique Spotify ID for the album.

field.name: album_release_date
field.description: Release date of the album (YYYY-MM-DD).

field.name: album_total_tracks
field.description: Total number of tracks in the album.

field.name: album_type
field.description: Type of album release (e.g., album, single, compilation). Helps distinguish between full-length projects and standalone tracks.

field.name: track_duration_min
field.description: Duration of the track in minutes. Derived from duration_ms for easier readability and time-based analysis.

This is the cleaned  version of the dataset  that contains detailed metadata for over 8,500 Spotify tracks, curated for analysis and machine learning applications. It includes normalized genre strings, standardized release dates, and filled missing values to ensure consistency and usability.

Key columns include track popularity, explicit content flags, artist and track names, and track numbers. All values have been cleaned to remove formatting inconsistencies, special characters, and null entries.

Ideal for exploratory data analysis, trend modeling, and music industry insights in 2025.

field.name: track_id
field.description: A unique identifier assigned by Spotify to each track.

field.name: track_name
field.description: The title of the track as listed on Spotify.

field.name: track_number
field.description: The track’s position within its album (e.g., 1 for the first track).

field.name: track_popularity
field.description: A score from 0 to 100 indicating how popular the track is on Spotify, based on recent plays.

field.name: track_duration_ms
field.description: he length of the track in milliseconds.

field.name: explicit
field.description: indicates whether the track contains explicit content (true or false).

field.name: artist_name
field.description: The name of the artist or band who performed the track.

field.name: artist_popularity
field.description: A score from 0 to 100 reflecting the artist’s overall popularity on Spotify.

field.name: artist_followers
field.description: The number of followers the artist has on Spotify.

field.name: artist_genres
field.description: A list of genre tags associated with the artist, such as "pop," "hip hop," or "indie rock." These genres are assigned by Spotify based on the artist’s musical style and listener behavior.

field.name: album_id
field.description: A unique identifier assigned by Spotify to the album.

field.name: album_name
field.description: The name of the album that contains the track.

field.name: album_release_date
field.description: The original release date of the album.

field.name: album_total_tracks
field.description: The total number of tracks included in the album.

field.name: album_type
field.description: The type of album, such as “album,” “single,” or “compilation.”

name: Spotify Songs for ML & Analysis (8700+ tracks)
description:
## 🕹️ About Dataset

### 🎯 Context  
What makes a song popular on Spotify?  
Do artist popularity and follower count influence track success more than audio features?  
How do album types and release dates shape listening trends?

These were the questions that inspired me to build this dataset.

Using Spotify’s API, I collected data on over **8,700 tracks**, capturing detailed metadata about songs, artists, and albums. This dataset is ideal for exploring the intersection of music analytics, artist influence, and streaming behavior.

---

### 📦 Content  
This dataset contains one CSV file with over 8,700 rows. Each row represents a unique track and includes metadata across three dimensions: **track**, **artist**, and **album**.

| Column Name           | Description |
|-----------------------|-------------|
| `track_id`            | Unique identifier for the track |
| `track_number`        | Track’s position on the album |
| `track_popularity`    | Spotify popularity score (0–100) |
| `track_duration_ms`   | Duration of the track in milliseconds |
| `explicit`            | Whether the track contains explicit content |
| `artist_name`         | Name of the performing artist |
| `artist_popularity`   | Spotify popularity score for the artist |
| `artist_followers`    | Number of Spotify followers for the artist |
| `album_id`            | Unique identifier for the album |
| `album_name`          | Name of the album |
| `album_release_date`  | Original release date of the album |
| `artist_genres`       | Genre tags associated with the artist |
| `album_total_tracks`  | Total number of tracks on the album |
| `album_type`          | Type of album (e.g., album, single, compilation) |

---

### 🙏 Acknowledgements  
All data was collected using the [Spotify Web API](https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/).  
This dataset is intended for educational and research purposes only.

---

### 💡 Inspiration  
You can use this dataset to:

- Analyze which artist traits correlate with track popularity  
- Explore genre trends across different album types and release years  
- Build machine learning models to predict song success  
- Visualize music trends using Power BI or Python  
- Compare artists, albums, or genres based on metadata

---

## Cleaned Version
A cleaned version of the dataset (`spotify_data_clean.csv`) is now available. It includes:
## Cleaning Process (SQL)

The cleaned dataset (`spotify_data_clean.csv`) was generated through a multi-step SQL pipeline designed to ensure consistency, completeness, and usability for analysis. Below is a summary of the transformations applied:

#🔍 Null Handling & Imputation
- Identified and removed rows with missing `track_name`.
- Imputed missing `artist_name`, `artist_popularity`, `artist_followers`, and `artist_genres` using album-level joins (e.g., for albums like *1989*).
- Replaced remaining nulls with default values:
  - `'N/A'` for strings
  - `0` for numeric fields
  - `'[]'` for genre arrays (temporary placeholder)

#✨ Standardization
- Trimmed whitespace from key fields: `track_name`, `artist_name`, `album_name`, `album_type`, `explicit`.
- Converted `explicit` values to uppercase (`TRUE` / `FALSE`).
- Cleaned `artist_genres` using regex to remove brackets and quotes.

# 📅 Release Date Normalization
- For year-only dates (e.g., `2020`), appended `-06-30` to estimate mid-year.
- For year-month formats (e.g., `2020-07`), appended `-01` to complete the date.
- Converted all dates to `DATE` format using `STR_TO_DATE()`.

#⏱ Duration Conversion
- Added a new column `track_duration_min` by converting `track_duration_ms` to minutes.
- Dropped the original `track_duration_ms` column after conversion.

# 🎵 Genre Enrichment
- Populated missing `artist_genres` for well-known artists using manual overrides:
  - *Taylor Swift*: `country, pop, indie, folk`
  - *Olivia Rodrigo*: `pop rock, alternative pop, pop punk`
  - *Billie Eilish*: `alternative pop, electropop, dark pop`
  - *(...and more for 10+ artists)*
- Remaining empty genres were replaced with `'N/A'`.

#🧹 Deduplication
- Used `ROW_NUMBER()` over `track_name`, `artist_name`, `album_name`, and `album_release_date` to identify duplicates.
- Removed duplicate rows and dropped the helper `row_num` column.

---

This SQL workflow ensures the dataset is clean, consistent, and ready for exploratory data analysis, genre modeling, and public sharing. All transformations were verified using sample queries and profiling tools.


---

## Example Analysis
Explore genre trends and usage patterns in this companion notebook:  
👉 [Top Genres Using Pandas](https://www.kaggle.com/code/alyahmedts13/top-genres-using-pandas)



### 🤝 Contribute  
Feel free to fork the dataset or share your analyses!  
If you clean, enrich, or expand the dataset, contributions are always welcome.
